required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Episil® Oral Liquid in Cancer Patients Suffering From Chemotherapy- and/or Radiation-induced Oral Mucositis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multi-center, Single-use, Active-controlled, Open Study to Assess the Local Analgesic Effect of Episil® Oral Liquid in Cancer Patients Suffering From Chemotherapy- and/or Radiation-induced Oral Mucositis

collaborator.agency: Solasia Medical Information Consulting (Shanghai) Co. Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, multi-center, single-use, active-controlled, two-stage open study of episil®. The purpose of this study is to assess the local analgesic effect of episil® in cancer patients suffering from chemotherapy- and/or radiation-induced oral mucositis, which will provide scientific and reliable clinical data in the product registration in China.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC) of pain score of oral mucositis
primary_outcome.time_frame: During 6 hours after a single use of investigational medical device
primary_outcome.description: Oral mucosal pain is assessed by a numerical score (0-10 Likert-pain scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain intensity decrease inside the oral cavity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 6 hours after a single use of investigational medical device
secondary_outcome.description: Oral mucosal pain is assessed by a numerical score (0-10 Likert-pain scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak pain intensity difference inside the oral cavity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 6 hours after a single use of investigational medical device
secondary_outcome.description: Oral mucosal pain is assessed by a numerical score (0-10 Likert-pain scale).

intervention.description: Firmly press the pump and apply the stream of liquid to the oral cavity 3 times (a total volume of 0.45 mL approximately). Distribute to affected areas in the mouth, for example by using the tongue. Wait for 5 minutes for the protective film to form.
Gently pour 5 mL of rinse into the mouth, keep the rinse staying in the oral cavity for at least 1 minute, and spilt out the liquid.

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

facility.name: Fourth Hospital of Hebei Medical University
The First Hospital of Jilin University
